page.title: 18SUPERNATURAL CURDWORTH
page.content: THIS SUBJECT DOES NOT HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH LIFE IN THE NINETEEN EIGHTIES, BUT ALWAYS SEEMS TO INTEREST PEOPLE. SIGHTINGS TOLD ABOUT IN CURDWORTH, ARE, OF A CAVALIER, SEEN IN A YARD IN DAYLIGHT; AN OLD MAN SITTING IN THE LOUNGE OF A NEWLY BUILT HOUSE; A MAN IN BYEGONE CLOTHING IN COLESHILL ROAD; OTHER TALES INCLUDE THE COACH AND HORSES APPEARING ONCE A YEAR IN CHURCH LANE; A WHITE HORSE ON THE CORNER, OPPOSITE THE SAME NAMED PUBLIC HOSTELRY, REPUTEDLY SEEN BY A CLERGYMAN, (WHO WAS NOT LEAVING THE SAID HOSTELRY). MOTORISTS HAVE SWERVED TO AVOID A WOMAN SEEN ON KINGSBURY ROAD, WHO HAS DISAPPEARED WHEN THEY HAVE LOOKED BACK. BUILDINGS NOW DEMOLISHED THAT WERE SAID TO BE HAUNTED WERE THE OLD RECTORY AND A FARM THAT REPUTEDLY HOUSED A POLTERGEIST.
